channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How cuts to federal climate funds could threaten polar vortex research
item.description: Tens of millions of people are in the path of a major winter storm. Federal cuts threaten efforts to understand the causes of such weather.

item.title: Millions of Americans brace for winter storm. And, Zelenskyy's warning for Europe
item.description: Millions of Americans are bracing for a massive, life-threatening winter storm this weekend. And, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivers a stark messa...

item.title: Ice may be more hazardous than snow this weekend. What to expect and how to prepare.
item.description: A major winter storm is expected to impact more than 200 million people in United States this weekend. Freezing rain and ice is a particular concern.

item.title: Who's Board of Peace and who's bored of peace? The quiz knows — do you?
item.description: Plus: The Oscars, tool-using animals, Nobel drama and more.

item.title: 'Pain, betrayal, sadness': Danish veterans describe shock of Trump admin rhetoric
item.description: Danish veterans say the rhetoric from the Trump administration has been painful. They describe feeling betrayed and abandoned by an ally after standin...

item.title: US braces for 'extremely dangerous' winter storm
item.description: The National Weather Service warns the winter blast "will pose a life-threatening risk of hypothermia".

item.title: Immigrants often don’t open the door to ICE, but that may no longer stop officers
5 arrested in connection with shooting of judge, wife in Indiana
item.description: Five people have been arrested in connection with the Sunday shooting of a judge and his wife​ in Indiana, according to authorities.

item.title: Mandela's prison key, sunglasses and shirt can be sold after daughter wins court battle
item.description: The authorities tried to stop their export arguing they were part of the country's heritage.

item.title: ICE takes 5-year-old, dad after using boy as "bait," school district says
item.description: School district officials in Columbia Heights, Minnesota, say their sense of security is shaken and their hearts shattered after four students from th...

item.title: Beauty salon, others sanctioned for trafficking cocaine to U.S.
item.description: The sanctions target family-operated companies, including Magic Esthetic Salon, linked to alleged drug trafficking and money laundering.

item.title: Liz Hurley and Anna Wintour among mourners at Valentino's funeral in Rome
item.description: Crowds have gathered in Rome for the funeral of Italian fashion designer Valentino, who has died at the age of 93.

item.title: Maps show where winter storm threatens to bring snow, brutal cold this weekend
item.description: Heavy snow, ice and brutal cold are expected to make this winter storm a potentially life-threatening weather event for 35 states.

item.title: Minnesota gears up for anti-immigration enforcement protest Friday despite dangerous cold
item.description: A vast network of labor unions, progressive organizations and clergy has been asking Minnesotans to stay away from work, school and stores Friday to p...

item.title: Texas and Oklahoma brace for snow and ice as winter storm barrels toward eastern two-thirds of US
Trump's claim Nato troops avoided Afghanistan front line sparks outrage in UK
item.description: The US president says Nato troops stayed "a little off the front lines" - despite 457 UK military deaths in the conflict.

item.title: U.K. man accused of drugging, raping ex-wife for years to appear in court
item.description: Joanne Young has waived her right to anonymity as her ex-husband and five other men face trial for allegedly sexually abusing her over 13 years.

item.title: 'I didn't hear from my son for seven months': Inside Yemen's UAE-run secret prisons
item.description: The BBC sees sites on former United Arab Emirates bases in Yemen where detainees say they were abused.
